Name: Haven van Texel

Name: Haven van Texel

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: Went for lunch. Loved the split pea soup. So tasty and filling. Can‚Äôt get anything close to it in the states. Texels beer was also very good. Would have loved to sit outside on the canal but it was raining. We got the company of the house dog inside which was entertaining for sure.

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: Went for dinner and was not disappointed. Very nice staff, good portions, great prices! Would highly recommend for travelers looking for a quiet place to eat in the city.

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text:
This restaurant was a highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. The service was great and the cook even created a special vegan dish for me. I don't think you can eat with a more aesthetically pleasing view.
We lost a napkin in the canal tho rip.

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: The Texels beer is so amazing that it is making me plan a trip to the brewery in the island of Texel tomorrow haha. The servers are down to earth people and they guide you to every type of Texel beer to your tastebuds. As well as the ‚Ä¶

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: A pleasant place located right next to the canal. You can try here typical Dutch croquettes.

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: Beautifully situated along one of Amsterdam's canals, cosy and trendy outside seating which makes a relaxing and enjoyable dining experience. ‚Ä¶

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: Beautiful location on the canal. Just sit and watch the boats go by. Lovely Texel beer. Food looked good but we didn't eat there ourselves so can't say.

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: I ordered the special tonight, which was trout.  Absolutely perfect.  It was tender, flavorful and delicious. It was adorned with roasted brussel sprouts, zucchini, tomatoes and potatoes.  I also ordered a small pea soup as an appetizer, and it was as good as my mother used to make. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: Cute little restaurant that doesn‚Äôt feel overly touristy. Great service and really good menu. Pricing is reasonable and staff is friendly and eager to help. Nice view to boot.

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text:
Delicious foods and fresh Seafoods!
Very cozy and friendly place to dine in Amsterdam!

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: Staff were nice, food was yummy, windows have a lovely view of the canals. Very cosy place to hide from the rain. Recommending chicken satay.

Name: Haven van Texel

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: I really enjoyed sitting outside under the trees looking out over the canal and watching boats and people go by. It's relatively peaceful as it's not on the main road but there is a lively buzz of people around. ‚Ä¶

Name: Haven van Texel

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: The food was fantastic, especially the spare ribs. There are a few tables right next to the river with great views. Though the place was very busy when we visited, the staff was still quite attentive and fast.

Name: Haven van Texel

Name: Haven van Texel

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: 20min till the service will finally take our orders for 2 drinks??? It's a little bit too much if you ask me. But I would like to work here!! Stuff has indeed lots of fun - drinking behind the bar, kissing behind the bar, correcting make up ‚Ä¶

Name: Haven van Texel
Review Text: Has seating on the water where you can people watch and enjoy the canal. Decent food that comes out quickly, but staff seems unenthused to be there which takes something away (maybe that's just European service). Has specials that look good for dinner, though I was here for lunch.

+ it's a relaxed & calm spott in the <3 of Amsterdam

Review Text: We loved this bar and terrace beside the canal and near center etc. Good feeling / night openhours. Nice and friendly staff (incl. smallest staffdog). Review Text: Like its namesake island, they don't appear to like 'outsiders' in this place. Their grasp of English, or willingness to understand the language also seems far below par for Amsterdam. Would not visit again.
